data.title: Order of Eric Flint Books
data.meta_description: This is the Order of Eric Flint Books in both chronological order and publication order. List verified daily and newest books added immediately.
data.text:
Eric Flint was an American author of science fiction, alternate history and fantasy novels and short stories. Flint also works as an editor and as an e-publisher for the Baen Free Library. He is best known for his 1632 series. Flint got his PhD in History, but left the program due to political issues. From there, he worked various jobs until he got serious about writing and became a full-time writer in 1999. Eric frequently collaborates with other authors, such as David Drake, Dave Freer and David Weber.

Eric Flint made his debut as a published novelist in 1997 with Mother of Demons, which is his only solo standalone novel to date. Below is a list of Eric Flint’s books in order of when they were originally released (as well as in chronological order when necessary):

Publication Order of Anthologies

Notes: The novels 1633 and 1634: The Baltic War as well as the Honor Harrington books are co-authored by David Weber. 1634: The Galileo Affair, 1635: The Cannon Law and 1635: A Parcel of Rogues are co-authored by Andrew Dennis. 1634: The Ram Rebellion, 1634: The Bavarian Cross, 1635: The Dreeson Incident and 1635: The Tangled Web are co-authored by Virginia DeMarce. 1636: The Kremlin Games is co-authored by Paula Goodlett and Gorg Huff. 1635: The Papal Stakes and 1636: Commander Cantrell in the West Indies were co-authored by Charles E. Gannon. 1636: The Devil’s Opera is co-authored by David Carrico. 1636: The Viennese Waltz was written with Gorg Huff and Paula Goodlett. 1636: The Cardinal Virtues was written with Walter H. Hunt.

The Belisarius series, the Pyramid series, the novel The Tyrant and the novellas Pirates of the Suara Sea, Red Fiddler and The Witch’s Murder are co-authored with David Drake. The Rats, Bats and Vats series and the novel A Slow Train to Arcturus are co-authored by Dave Freer. The series Heirs of Alexandria is co-authored with Dave Freer and Mercedes Lackey. Forward the Mage is co-authored with Richard Roach. The Jao series is co-authored with K.D. Wentworth. The Boundary series is co-authored with Ryk E. Spoor. Time Spike is co-authored with Marilyn Kosmatka. The short story collection Odyssey is edited by Eric Flint and written by Keith Laumer. The Warmasters also contains contributions by David Drake and David Weber. Mountain Magic also has contributions from David Drake, Henry Kuttner and Ryk E. Spoor. The Aethers of Mars includes a sequel novella by Charles E. Gannon.

1637: The Volga Rules and The Alexander Inheritance were written with Paula Goodlett and Gorg Huff. The Gods of Sagittarius series is written with Mike Resnick. Iron Angels is written with Alistair Kimble.

If You Like Eric Flint Books, You’ll Love…

David Weber

Harry Turtledove

Tanya Huff
